Here's why we need nurse-resident ratios in aged care homes https://t.co/L9OaYYyBFC via @ConversationEDU
NP making the navigating easier for patients https://t.co/rM08nnZFxL
#pcnaust16 Connecting with patients through honest communication and showing interest in their personal lives improves outcomes on care
#Pcnaust16 Phillips: Honest communication and adequate information to make informed decisions on care are of high importane to patients
#PCNAust16 Phillips: effective communication, expert care, respect, finance, trust and confidence in staff important to patients and family
#PCNAust16 Phillips: 39% of palliative patients are admitted in hospital. Many do not receive adequate evidenced based palliative care.
#PCNAust16 Bhattarai: lack of education, inappropriate analgesics with high levels of pain in CHF causes viscious cycle of rehospitalisation
#PCNAust16 Bhattarai: mean pain score in CHF patients is 7. Patients D/C home without proper pain management plan
#PCNAust16 PCNPs increasingly performing episiodic care rather than continuity of care impacting on job satisfaction
#PCNAust16: Tuaoi: PCNP role valued in the Brisbane community. MBS and private health care funds to be revisited.
#PCNAust16 Push for data collection to prove the validity of NP role would not necessary improve acceptance of NPs
#PCNAust16 Kendall: I agree- Role isolation and the feeling of "not belonging"very common among NPs
#PCNAust16 Kendall: Developing and establishing NP scope and professional autonomy in PC is an enjoyable aspect of the NP role
#PCNAust16 Kendall's inspiring talk on the NP role in Regional Ballarat improving access to complex dying patients at home.
#pcnaust16 Picot:Homelessness, shared accom are clinical dilemmas in PC provision. Dx of Schizophrenia underdiagnosed and undertreated
#pcnaust16 Picot: people with severe MH illness die alone, or in RACF at a young age (10 to 20 years younger than average age)
#pcnaust16 Picot: ImPact MH and PC liaison group jointly improving and sustaining PC outcomes in South Australia
#PCNAust16 Currow: HP should connect better with oncology services to deliver better palliative care. Finally someone who is with me here
#PCNAust16 Currow: Improvement in disease outcomes with targeted therapies has not been seen in the adjuvant setting.
#PCNAust16 Currow: small minority of people have cancer as chronic disease. Functional decline starts long way before.
#PCNAust16 Currow: 1 single #RTx as efficient then 10# in treating pain bony mets. Why is evidence not applied into practice?
#PCNAust16 Currow People referred to PC who could benefit from oncology assessment to improve survival. Outcomes depend on where you live
#PCNAust16 Currow: mortality 4 times greater in low volume hospital compared with high volume hospital. Low volume = less information
#PCNAust16 Currow: Not being a burden to others is more important than place of death for PC Cancer patients
#PCNAust16 Currow: Being treated as a " whole person" , maintaining dignity and humor, not dying alone, someone who will listen is PCC
#PCNAust16 10 alternative tips for better health https://t.co/Nu9YaN30t8
#PCNAust16 Currow says whole of health system issue in providing good PC. Sometimes referral to oncology too late
#PCNAust16 Better pain management in dementia can be achieved with connecting with and knowing the patient.
#PCNAust16 Fisher-patient centred care in dementia pain management is about connecting with the patient and considering integrating setting
#PCNAust16 Fisher systemac review of pain assessment tools in dementia not valid including Abbey scale. All lack evidence
#PCNAust16 Fisher says vital signs not a good indicator in assessment of pain in dementia
#PCNAust16 Fisher verbal descriptive pain score works with MMST score above 10, however self score not always reliable as dementia fluctuate
#PCNAust16 Fisher: someone with dementia has cognitive problems with the dimensionhs of pain. Emotional component is very difficult
#PCNAust16 Pain is the radical failure of language https://t.co/YTiVEr3Q8B
#PCNAust16 conference taking off in Canberra.
